SEARCH
Package com.example.chicksevent

Class TEST44_US030801_AdminNotificationLogsUITest

java.lang.Object
com.example.chicksevent.TEST44_US030801_AdminNotificationLogsUITest
public class TEST44_US030801_AdminNotificationLogsUITest extends Object
UI tests for US 03.08.01: As an administrator, I want to review logs of all notifications sent to entrants by organizers. These instrumented tests verify that:
  • Administrators can navigate to the notification logs screen
  • Notification logs list is displayed
  • All notifications sent to entrants by organizers are visible
  • Notification details (message, type, event ID, user ID) are displayed
  • Notification list is scrollable when there are many notifications
  • Edge cases (empty list, multiple notifications) are handled properly
Note: For reliable test execution, it's recommended to disable animations on the test device/emulator before running these tests: 
 adb shell settings put global animator_duration_scale 0
 adb shell settings put global window_animation_scale 0
 adb shell settings put global transition_animation_scale 0
To re-enable animations after testing: 
 adb shell settings put global animator_duration_scale 1
 adb shell settings put global window_animation_scale 1
 adb shell settings put global transition_animation_scale 1
Note: Full end-to-end testing requires:
  • Firebase test data (notifications sent by organizers to entrants)
  • Navigation to NotificationAdminFragment from AdminHomeFragment
  • Admin user authentication
These tests focus on UI element visibility and basic interactions.

    • admin_canNavigateToNotificationLogsScreen

      public void admin_canNavigateToNotificationLogsScreen()
      Test Case 1: Admin can navigate to notification logs screen. As an administrator, I should be able to navigate to the screen where I can review logs of all notifications sent to entrants by organizers.

      Note: This test requires navigation to NotificationAdminFragment from AdminHomeFragment. For now, we verify the UI structure exists.

    • admin_notificationLogsScreen_displaysHeaderTitle

      public void admin_notificationLogsScreen_displaysHeaderTitle()
      Test Case 2: Notification logs screen displays header title. As an administrator, when I navigate to the notification logs screen, I should see a clear header indicating I'm viewing notification logs.

    • admin_notificationList_displayedInListView

      public void admin_notificationList_displayedInListView()
      Test Case 3: Notification list is displayed in ListView. As an administrator, I should see a list of all notifications sent to entrants by organizers displayed in a ListView.

    • admin_notificationList_displaysOrganizerNotifications

      public void admin_notificationList_displaysOrganizerNotifications()
      Test Case 4: Notification list displays notifications sent by organizers. As an administrator, the notification list should display all notifications that were sent to entrants by organizers.

    • admin_notificationItems_displayMessage

      public void admin_notificationItems_displayMessage()
      Test Case 5: Notification items display notification message. As an administrator, each notification item should display the message that was sent to the entrant.

    • admin_notificationItems_displayNotificationType

      public void admin_notificationItems_displayNotificationType()
      Test Case 6: Notification items display notification type. As an administrator, each notification item should display the type of notification (WAITING, INVITED, CANCELLED, etc.).

    • admin_notificationItems_displayEventId

      public void admin_notificationItems_displayEventId()
      Test Case 7: Notification items display event ID. As an administrator, each notification item should display the event ID associated with the notification.

    • admin_notificationItems_displayUserId

      public void admin_notificationItems_displayUserId()
      Test Case 8: Notification items display user ID (entrant ID). As an administrator, each notification item should display the user ID of the entrant who received the notification.

    • admin_notificationList_isScrollable

      public void admin_notificationList_isScrollable()
      Test Case 9: Notification list is scrollable. As an administrator, if there are many notifications, I should be able to scroll through the list to see all of them.

    • admin_multipleNotifications_canBeDisplayed

      public void admin_multipleNotifications_canBeDisplayed()
      Test Case 10: Multiple notifications can be displayed. As an administrator, I should be able to see multiple notifications in the list and scroll through them.

    • admin_emptyNotificationList_handledGracefully

      public void admin_emptyNotificationList_handledGracefully()
      Test Case 11: Empty notification list is handled. As an administrator, if there are no notifications in the system, the screen should handle this gracefully.

    • admin_notificationsFromDifferentOrganizers_displayed

      public void admin_notificationsFromDifferentOrganizers_displayed()
      Test Case 12: Notifications from different organizers are displayed. As an administrator, I should be able to see notifications sent by different organizers to different entrants.
